archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.physdesc: 1 box and 1 oversize folder; 0.4 cu. ft.
did.abstract: Czeslawa Zielinska is a Polish-born Canadian architect and the inventor the GETSET Building System and, with her husband Zenon, of the UCOPAN, a pre-cast concrete building system. The collection includes promotional material, published articles, and booklets about UCOPAN as well as copies of landscape and building sketches drawn during her travels.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Czeslawa Zielinska Architectural Papers must be obtained from the Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Czeslawa Zielinska Architectural Papers, Ms2005-017, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Czesia Zielinska Architectural Papers were donated to the International Archive of Women in Architecture at the Special Collections by their creator in 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement and description of the Czeslawa Zielinska Architectural Papers took place in August 2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Czeslawa (or Czesia) Zielinska is a Polish-born Canadian architect and inventor. She was educated in Poland and holds both a Master of Science degree in Architecture from the Warsaw Technical University in 1952 and a Master of Science in Interior Design from the Academy of Fine Arts in Warsaw in 1962. Zielinska invented the patented GETSET Building System (prefabricated components for building structures and modular furniture), and is co-inventor with her husband, structural engineer Zenon A. Zielinski, of patented UCOPAN (Universal Concrete Panel System). She is a partner in UCOPAN Enterprises and is a member of Royal Institute of Architecture of Canada as well as the Interior Decorators Society of Quebec. Her specialization is in integrated exterior-interior architectural and structural design, low cost housing as well as furniture and product design.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes Zielinska's curriculum vitae, a Canadian patent certificate, promotional literature on UCOPAN as well as published papers and articles relevant to UCOPAN's uses and deployment abroad. It also includes photocopies of landscape and building sketches she drew while she and her family were living in Egypt and India from 1966-1967 on Ford Foundation grants about low income housing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by subject matter, starting with her curriculum vita, followed by information on UCOPAN and her personal sketches.
